programmes.show_description: (2018) Melissa McCarthy and Richard E. Grant star in this witty biographical drama about a literary fraudster who forges lucrative letters by dead celebrities.
Alan Davies and Joe Lycett traverse around Trieste, shoot the breeze at the Wind Museum, go food and fizz pairing in Prosecco, have a painting lesson and even pop into Slovenia.
In the Drink: Gordon attempts to revamp an inconsistent country club and golf course restaurant in New Jersey. It's dark, it's gloomy and the food's attracting complaints.
Competing to host the best party in Grimsby are straight-talking Mel and Patrick, seasoned ravers Vanessa and Steve and lovebirds Amber and Ryan, whose matching pink outfits raise eyebrows.
Some extra brunch as Tim Lovejoy and Simon Rimmer host the food and chat show.
In this revisit edition, Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer see whether Rik and Helen found their home in Manchester, and discover if Alison and Phil's big move in Herefordshire worked out.
Another chance to catch yesterday's new episode, with Kelvin Fletcher in Dictionary Corner. Colin Murray, Rachel Riley and Susie Dent host.
Rat Girl: Lilith is heartbroken when her favourite lab rat dies. Sam's surprised when a bar customer rejects his advances - and is stunned when he finds out why.
Home Malone: Frasier asks Sam to babysit young Frederick, despite Lilith's reservations, but the evening is a disaster. Woody's girlfriend Kelly gets a job at Cheers.
Uncle Sam Wants You: Rebecca's at a crossroads and attends job interviews. Sam wants to be a father and gets an unusual suggestion about who the mother of his child should be.
Odd Man Out: Frank forces Marco to choose either Marie or him as a friend. Ray sides with Frank because he doesn't approve of his mother having a male friend.
Ray's Ring: Ray loses his wedding ring and is propositioned by a woman at the airport. When Debra finds out what happened, she pretends to be single too...
Frank Goes Downstairs: After hurting themselves during a tryst, Ray and Debra say they fell down the stairs. But when Frank gets hurt doing some DIY, they begin to feel guilty.
Love Bites Dog: Roz takes the trouble to set Frasier up on a blind date with her friend, but it's Bulldog who ends up falling in love.
The Impossible Dream: When Frasier's awakened night after night by a recurring dream, he becomes obsessed with discovering its true meaning.
A Crane's Critique: While enjoying a quiet coffee, Frasier and Niles realise that they're sitting next to one of America's most famous authors.
Head Game: Niles becomes a big hit with a famous basketball player when he fills in for Frasier at the radio station.
Let's Be Frank: When Frank meets Frank, it's a match made in picking heaven. And in Illinois, the guys discover a treasure trove of unusual micro cars.
Channel 4's midday news summary.
Ultima Mk3: Fuzz Townshend and Tim Shaw head to Cambridgeshire to fix up their very first supercar: a rare 1989 Ultima race car that's been gathering dust for 30 years.

programmes.show_name: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programmes.show_description: In Gloucestershire, Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien meet avid collector Bryan. Henry upcycles some old oxygen regulators while Simon restores a stylish, traditional wooden dresser.
Colin Murray, Rachel Riley and Susie Dent host, with Kelvin Fletcher in Dictionary Corner, as contestants race against the clock to pit their wits against vowels, consonants and numbers.
Sandra and Dave want a holiday home in southern Alicante for all their family to enjoy. Ben Hillman shows them five fab options for their £100k budget, but are any of them perfect?

programmes.show_name: A New Life in the Sun
programmes.show_description: Gill and Robin complete their Tuscan hillside retreat. Stretch and Rachael take on a busy summer season. And did David and Lane make the right move?
The new run continues. It's payment day following a wonderful week in Wales. The problem is, none of the B&Bers can agree on what exactly was wonderful about it.
The new run continues. In Bradford, Tom draws on his French heritage to deliver simple dishes executed well. And as the final scores are revealed, who has that je ne sais quoi? (Ep5/5)

programmes.show_name: New: A Place in the Sun
programmes.show_description: Sarah and Nigel look for a dream holiday home on Spain's Costa del Garraf for £265k, from a townhouse ticking all the boxes and a gorgeous garden apartment to a classy Catalan curveball.
Channel 4's flagship news programme. Including the weather.
Denise Van Outen explores the eye-opening reasons why we can't get no sleep; from food and hormones to the sneaky sleep-thief of snoring. How we can stay in the land of Nod?
On the Gogglebox: Britain's Got Talent, The Heat, 56 Days, Olivia Attwood: Getting Filthy Rich, Ed Stafford's Rite of Passage, and Alice Roberts: Our Hospital Through Time.
Jason Manford, Lou Sanders and Bella Hull join Adam Hills, Josh Widdicombe and Alex Brooker for a satirical round-up of the past seven days.
...Joe Lycett: In his award-winning stand up show, Joe Lycett lampoons everything from tyrannical Post Office jobsworths to the stupidity of celebrities on Twitter.
(2022) Meta-comedy horror 're-quel' with Courteney Cox. Killer Ghostface returns to shock the younger generation out of their love of 'elevated horror' with a bit of old-fashioned slashing.
Da Mimmo: Gordon tries to transform New Jersey Italian restaurant Da Mimmo, which is run by a mother and her three sons - two of whom see the business as a failure...
The competition kicks off at Abbey House in Penrith, Cumbria, where Ian Sugden and his wife Sam treat their guests to an afternoon on the firing range and fancy bacon for breakfast.
Lisa Holloway prides herself on providing a home from home at Compton House in Newark, Nottinghamshire. But there are dusty discoveries, and Dave and Jo find the prices hard to swallow.
Dave and Jo Bate hope that their guests will embrace the pub vibe at The White Horse in Ripon, North Yorkshire. But Ed and Jane get locked in their room and it's 'tomatogate' at breakfast.
Former teachers Ed and Jane host at The Old Farmhouse in Cheshire. Some of their guests are surprised to be sharing a bathroom, and Sam and Ian are shocked by what's lurking under the bed.
The B&Bers meet for one last time to settle some scores and find out how much they've been paid. A heated exchange about cleaning leads to tears before the winner is announced.
In West Yorkshire, there are terrible jokes, comedy teeth, plate licking and a conga, as three couples compete to host the best dinner party.
Work Related: Doug and Deacon compete to play the best practical joke, and Arthur is offered a job at Carrie's office.
Better Camera: Doug's Christmas present for Carrie is overshadowed by the one she gets from her boss. With recurring guest stars Ricki Lake and Lou Ferrigno.
Wedding Presence: Doug and Carrie don't want to go to their friends' wedding in Maryland, so they concoct an elaborate plan to fool them into thinking that they're there.
Hi-Def Jam: Doug sees a TV that's better than his 55-inch. When he finds out Carrie's boss has one, he schemes to get himself and the boys invited over to watch the Super Bowl.
Jealous Robert: Debra and Marie's good intentions backfire when they try to drive Robert back into Amy's arms - and find out that Amy and Gianni are hitting it off.
It's Supposed to Be Fun: While the Barones watch their sons play basketball, Ray notices that Geoff is having trouble getting the hang of the game.
Older Women: It's the first Thanksgiving since Debra's parents divorced, and she's happy that they've both agreed to have dinner with the family. But her dad's bringing a date...
Mixed Doubles: Daphne's inconsolable when her boyfriend breaks up with her, and Niles decides it's time to declare his true feelings for her.
A Lilith Thanksgiving: Frasier and Lilith are reunited when they try to convince the principal of a popular private school that their son is the perfect candidate.
Our Father Whose Art Ain't Heaven: Martin buys Frasier an expensive piece of art, but Frasier hates it.
Dad Loves Sherry, the Boys Just Whine: Frasier and Niles are surprised by Martin's reaction to being dumped by his girlfriend, Maureen.
Go Big or Go Homer: Homer mentors a middle-aged intern and inspires him to follow his dreams. What's the worst that could happen?
The Winter of Our Monetized Content: Homer and Bart become viral sensations. Meanwhile, Lisa is sent to detention and is forced to make licence plates.
Gorillas on the Mast: Homer buys a boat but is shocked when he finds out how much it costs to run it. Lisa frees a whale, so Bart frees a gorilla.
(2007) Animated comedy. When Homer's love for a pig causes world-threatening pollution, Springfield gets enclosed in a huge dome. D'oh! Will he do the decent thing and save his neighbours?
The competition begins at The View in Tynemouth, run by Graeme and Brenda. Their B&B has royal history, but their guests don't think the shared bathrooms are very regal.
Visit two is to the Northern Hotel in Brechin, Angus, where hosts Pawel and Joanna like to go the extra mile. Things start off brilliantly, but a breakfast breakdown could be costly.
Jess hosts the third visit of the week, at The Kirkstyle Inn in Dunning, near Perth. She's hoping that the quirky style will be a hit, but two guests aren't fans of the open-plan design.
The week's final visit is to Hazeldene Guest House in Perth, run by hospitality veterans Rob and Glenda. Their plan? Get their guests in good spirits with a trip to a whisky distillery.
It's payment day, and time for the B&Bers to confront each other about their stays. There are some frosty heating comments and brekkie bombshells before the winners are revealed.
...Restoration: Sandi Toksvig tackles fly-tipping. At the parish council, she recruits a group of outdoorsy men for building duty. And there's a solstice party for Sandi's Wood. (Ep3/3)
Channel 4's flagship news programme. Including the weather.
...the World: In March 2011, Japan was hit by a devastating tsunami, killing 20,000 and triggering a nuclear meltdown. Survivors and witnesses tell their extraordinary stories. (Ep1)
...the World: In March 2011, a massive tsunami caused a major meltdown at Japan's Fukushima nuclear plant, triggering explosions and evacuations. What went wrong at Fukushima? (Ep2)

programmes.show_name: New: Roman Empire by Train with...
programmes.show_description: ...Alice Roberts: Alice discovers ancient gems in Parma. In Turin, she learns all about Roman bread, before catching a train up and across the Alps with Hannibal on her mind... (Ep4)
Comedian, musician and curious wanderer Bill Bailey embarks on a wildly entertaining journey through Vietnam, starting in Hoi An with some fancy food and a world-class tailor. (Ep1)
...Protocol: (2011) Part four of the Tom Cruise action-thriller franchise. The Impossible Missions Force fight to clear their name, while also trying to avert nuclear war. Busy, busy, busy!
